comment: She is an amazing teacher. I had her for learning support and 1101 and she is just amazingggg. Not everyone can teach and make you understand, but she does make sure that you understand everything and her tests. papers and homeworks are easy. You have to write your essays in order to get a grade in 1101 because that's what its all about.

Lots of in-class peer reviews. Willing to help if you put in the effort. Assigns readings for homework and has you write your opinion on it on discussion board. Likes to go over reading for class discussion. No final. Very friendly and funny. Made sure to ask for students opinions for certain projects. Easy B or A. Provides good feedback on essays!
I loved her! She was there for you and would help you if you asked her. I would love to have her as my professor again. As long as you do what you are suppose to you'll be fine.

Ms. Gresham was awesome. Class isn't very hard. There were only 4 papers, a final project, and classonline discussions. She is a tough grader but if you take your time and ask for help on your papers then you'll easily make a B or an A. Definitely take her :)

Ms Gresham helps you out a lot. She makes it clear what to write about in essays and will proof read your paper and help you during peer review. She's really nice. No tests, just a few essays and then online discussion boards etc. Always gives good feedback on essays to help improve in the future. I would recommend her!

What a good professor. I was hesitant about taking her course once I read the previous rate my professor reviews. Boy am I glad that I did take her class though, because I truly am a better writer now. I know how to argue, and I am so ready for round two in ENGL1102. She can be a tough grader, but if you work hard you can pull out high B's and A's.

Ms. Gresham is amazing! She works with all of her students and he proofreads almost everyone's papers. She makes her classes interesting with her funny, sarcastic behavior. I would recommend taking her if you love group conversations and are willing to work while having fun.
She gives no tests, we wrote 3 or 4 papers and they were only 3 pages long. Very easy classes and always got out of class early. Defiantly an easy course.

I often compared my papers to my friend's who made all A's while I was getting B's and C's and thought that something was weird. My papers were just as good if not better so I do not think she is a fair grader. I made an A on every assignment in my English 1101 class and was making terrible grades in her class.

She's a sweet woman and will try to sympathize with you. Terrible grader and is very unclear about what she wants in an essay. I am an A+ student that finished with a mediocre B and I was not happy about it. Gives you the opportunity to correct a not so great essay. I truly did not really learn much in her class; we just wrote a lot...

Attendance is mandatory, written assignments due every week (sometimes twice a week). Will help you if you help yourself. Class discussions are interesting. A "B" is realistic if you follow assignment guidelines and actually try to write well.

Ms. Gresham is OK. If you're an average level writer just trying to get through Gen Ed. classes and do what moderate work she assigns, you'll do fine and end up with a B. Only 6 out of 30 of us got an A. Use the writing center; they really do help and she has more sympathy for you when grading

She is really nice and pretty cool. Yeah, she is strict with the essays but you can write them again to get a better grade. I like that she is laid back and makes sure the class isn't boring. As long as you do your work and stuff, you will get a good grade. She will feeds everyone. We got pizza and cupcakes!

She is very unrealistic with grades. The comments she leaves on your essays don't match the actual grade. She is VERY UNCLEAR on the what she wants for essays. She explains it exactly how she types it which doesn't help at all. She helps you out sometimes then sometime she doesn't. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.
